item.description:
“You gotta take advantage of the best film festival in Boston, and you gotta meetup with other members to help sort through the 110 screenings of which you've never heard. No better place to do that than a Sunday afternoon at Back Bay Social Club.”

The10th Annual  Boston Independent Film Festival runs from August 25 - May 2.  Screenings will take place at the Somerville Theatre in Davis Square, the Brattle Theatre in Harvard Square, and the Coolidge Corner Theatre in Brookline.

This year's opening night film is

Sleepwalk With Me
Wed. 4/25 - 7:30pm - Somerville Theatre Screen 1
Adapted from Mike Birbiglia’s “This American Life” segments, this comedy is a charming, hilarious exploration of the difficult prospect of facing reality. Produced and co-written by Ira Glass.

Our Pow Wow Wow gives us an opportunity to pour over all the selections, dicsuss the merits of each film, and try to coordinate schedules in such a way that folks can maximize their experience.  Nothing is worse than missing 'the one great film', and nothing is better than being part of a group that sees an event that will be talked about for years:

  • Ben Kingsley after Transibbearian
  • Debra Granick and Josh Hawkes following Winter's Bone
  • Hall Holbrook and Dixie Carter following That Evening Sun
  • Players and Coaches from Push: Madison V. Madison

To help you get started, check out: IFF Boston 2012 Films and Schedule


In addition, Jim has put together a list of the films complete with IMDB and RT ratings:

  • 2012 IFF Boston film lineup

Passes go on sale on or around April 1.

Tickets for IFFBoston Members go on sale on or around April 9.

Tickets for everyone go on sale on or around April 11.

The extra Wow is for new members, or those who've missed the IFF in years past.  You are especially invited to this event. Come for a real 'film' discussion, one that will make your festival experience become a new tradition, with new friends with whom to enjoy films all year.
